comments.author: Free Market Capitalist
comments.body: I get lost in this. The truth is that I only glanced at the bounties from time to time, but I wanted to ask. What you get from the bounties is enough to live in a poor country? That way you would understand people having several accounts and a team as it seems in this case.Are we talking about some people managing several accounts and then several of those united in a team, until reaching the 145 accounts of a team?

comments.author: FatFork
comments.body: I appreciate your excellent investigation, Cantsay. With so many accounts, it's hard to imagine how one individual would manage them all. I doubt it's just one person and it could well be family members who are in on the deception. But, no doubt, there is some crazy shit going on.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: I don't doubt about a minute that all the accounts cited by the OP are a big farm. Have you heard of bots? So this is exactly what we are seeing.In fact, this is not the whole farm, yesterday I negatively tagged a few dozen more accounts, for almost the same thing.I understand that it is difficult to make money in poor countries. But at the same time, for all of us, in the same way, "there is never too much money." However, we do not become impudent and participate in the forum honestly.I will check the accounts by the time of their participation, synchronization of actions, and also mark this company.

comments.author: Pandu Geddon
comments.body: 145 accounts, this is quite a large account farm.I'm not sure everything will be managed by just one person. but seeing this finding, later there will be a defense that they are a community group or as we often hear.most accounts only participate in social media campaigns and articles. that means they have multiple social media accounts, or simply copy articles from 1 account and repost them on another account.this is the cunning act of a greedy person.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Garbage in -> Garbage out.Looking at a random bunch of posts / tweets and other things from this farm they are IMO worthless to the project.But, as with many of these tokens they are worthless in general and just exist to suck money from the people into the developers pockets.So, if you don't want to do anything but scam, the only people who are going to help you are scammers.Looking at it, how many people who are on this thread as of now would want to be associated with the projects these people are posting / tweeting / writing about?-Dave

comments.author: Lucius
comments.body: Maybe this picture is just an example of how bounty hunters are organized, and maybe now they already work in much bigger premises like warehouses and factories? Be that as it may, although I understand that it is difficult for people to survive (especially today), but is it even possible to earn something from all those worthless tokens that sometimes they don't even get for their work?Quote from: DaveF on August 29, 2022, 03:14:29 PM~snip~Looking at it, how many people who are on this thread as of now would want to be associated with the projects these people are posting / tweeting / writing about?I know that I would never agree to be associated with such and similar projects, but there are always those who will not only promote such projects, but also manage them for the right price. According to the criteria of this forum, some bounty managers are members with very high trust, and they don't mind being associated with such projects.

comments.author: lovesmayfamilis
comments.body: Quote from: Pandu Geddon on August 29, 2022, 02:22:03 PM145 accounts, this is quite a large account farm.I'm not sure everything will be managed by just one person. but seeing this finding, later there will be a defense that they are a community group or as we often hear.I've looked deeper into these accounts, and I'm pretty sure it's the work of a machine. Registration in the bounty takes place in batches, with a difference of seconds, and minutes. If someone starts to convince me that this is a company of people, friends who suddenly decided to participate in the bounty every minute, and after registration has the same time to leave the forum, I will never believe it.Even if there are companies of friends, there will still be a time difference, in this case, everything happens clearly like clockwork.The task is to register several accounts, then register in another company, and so on.But what the OP caught, unfortunately, is not the limit.It is difficult to fight the machine, but one day the machines break down and fail.Accounts with synced activities are marked with a negative tag.

comments.author: Timelord2067
comments.body: I've actually been advised both publicly in the forum and privately via PM that most users here can't comprehend more that two or three UID's are connected in any one post.Â  You might want to break the proof down into "connection set one" "connection set two" etc.Â  A graph showing how the smaller subsets are connected to each-other is also a good starting point as it shows the interconnectivity of the various subsets given there is no outright connection across the board of one wallet address that is used by all.Â While I haven't raked through the entire list, if true, it's a good catch.

comments.author: YOSHIE
comments.body: Quote from: Pandu Geddon on August 29, 2022, 02:22:03 PM145 accounts, this is quite a large account farm.I'm not sure everything will be managed by just one person. but seeing this finding, later there will be a defense that they are a community group or as we often hear.I'm trying to understand the encounter about Alt accounts found by: @Cantsay, 145 accounts do not belong to a single person, in the proof history the address shown here, states as below.My assessment, from the information and evidence available, the account is managed by: 63 different people, each of them 1 person has an Alt account 2-4 accounts that he manages, 145 accounts do not belong to one person, 145 accounts are managed by 63 different people, it is not clear if they are one office/village/organization, it is clear they have Alt 1-4 accounts for each person.It's just that @Cantsay, puts everything in a box, just correct me if my understanding is wrong.

comments.author: _BlackStar
comments.body: Quote from: YOSHIE on August 29, 2022, 03:53:34 PMMy assessment, from the information and evidence available, the account is managed by: 63 different people, each of them 1 person has an Alt account 2-4 accounts that he manages, 145 accounts do not belong to one person, 145 accounts are managed by 63 different people, it is not clear if they are one office/village/organization, it is clear they have Alt 1-4 accounts for each person.Regardless of whether it is own by 1 person or more, it is clear that 145 account use 63 different wallet. This doesn't show it's 1 person, but also doesn't prove it's more than 1 person but every 2-4 account use the same 1 wallet up to 63 different wallet among all accounts.It's a big farm, but to be honest I wouldn't tag them individually to 145 accounts. One of my reasons for that is because the bounty manager doesn't care about all these cheaters even though the bounty rules have warned him. No matter how many thousands of newbie were caught and tagged for cheating, they would continue to exist for even bigger waves.But OP, I appreciate your time and hard work. You are amazing.

comments.author: Bitcoin_Arena
comments.body: Woow this brings back the memories of polar91 and his massive merit and signature abusing farm of high ranking accounts.Â  Quote from: FatFork on August 29, 2022, 12:58:30 PMI appreciate your excellent investigation, Cantsay. With so many accounts, it's hard to imagine how one individual would manage them all. I doubt it's just one person and it could well be family members who are in on the deception. But, no doubt, there is some crazy shit going on.You will be surprised by how far account farmers can go.Polar91 had around 109 documented high ranking alts that were not only participating in bounties but some signature campaigns too. as soon as the accounts were busted, they all became inactive from that time showing that it was probably one individual or perhaps a couple of them.
